item.title: Soda Ash Royalty Reduction Act of 2005

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Energy and Mineral Resources.

item.text: Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 413.
Introduced in the Senate. Read the first time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under Read the First Time.
For further action, see S.203, which became Public Law 109-338 on 10/12/2006.

summary.text:
Soda Ash Royalty Reduction Act of 2006 - Lowers, for a five-year period, the royalty rate on the quantity or gross value of the output of sodium compounds and related products at the point of shipment to market from federal land to 2%.

Directs the Secretary of the Interior to report to Congress, after four years, on the effects of such royalty reduction, including: (1) the amount of sodium compounds and related products at the point of shipment to market from federal land during such four-year period; (2) the number of jobs that have been created or maintained during the royalty reduction period; (3) the total amount of royalty paid to the United States on the quantity or gross value of the output of sodium compounds and related products at the point of shipment to market produced during that four-year period, and the portion of such royalty paid to states; and (4) a recommendation of whether the reduced royalty rate should apply after the end of the five-year period beginning on the date of the enactment of this Act.

bill.title: Soda Ash Royalty Reduction Act of 2006

item.title: Soda Ash Royalty Reduction Act of 2006
Soda Ash Royalty Reduction Act of 2006
A bill to reduce temporarily the royalty required to be paid for sodium produced on Federal lands, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 413.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
